title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process included and initial phone screen with HR and the hiring manager. Then there were behavioral interviews with the hiring manager, team members, and other enterprise stakeholders. The final component was take-home case study, which included both quantitative and qualitative components.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with failure or things not going according the plan?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward nursing interview with no trick questions or ones that are challenging. They are more so making sure you fit the unit as opposed to making sure you are qualified
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced adversity?

title: Financial Care Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email to set up interview virtually. I originally interview for a different position. After going over my resume I was asked it I’d be interested in this position. I said sure.
Interview Questions: Why would we want to hire you? Have you ever had to work with someone who has different values than you?

title: Covid Vaccinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Very short and decisive. Loved the person and they really didn’t ask a lot of questions. Great for students looking for a little bit of extra cash. Just be yourself in the interview.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work for Duke University

title: Transplant Coordinator (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: One long day, meet with mds and other coordinators. Doing zoom sessions now as well as a shadowing component which is highly recommended- especially for nurses who are transitioning away from the bedside.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: CNA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going and friendly interview process. Questions were not out of the ordinary and were fairly straightforward. I was able to ask as many questions as I could think of and they answered them all thoroughly.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses. A time you overcame a challenge.

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Pretty chill. Ask a good amount of questions about past experience and why Duke health and this role. I will be honest, I am more filling this out just to see glassdoor information. Don't really have much else to contribute.
Interview Questions: What skills would make me good for this role.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: You first have to Interview with HR, and they ask general nurse interview questions, and give an overview of benefits. If you pass initial screening will get an interview with unit manager
Interview Questions: Why did you want to go into nursing? Tell me about a time you delivered quality patient care.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Had a Zoom interview.interview went went.interviewer was interesting and patient to explain processes and answer questions.i am looking forward to joining the duke family and I know I will love it here with Duke
Interview Questions: What I know about duke health

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great process for onboarding as long as you have everything in time to start. Proof of education and work references. Proof of all vax. Background check. Training and orientation after onboarding completed.
Interview Questions: Experience, what do you bring to the company, and your 5 year plan

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview with the hiring manager, panel interview with a combination of developers, analysts and managers, and a final interview with senior leader. The entire interview process took 6 weeks.
Interview Questions: Dealing with a difficult employee

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with manager and other TAs. Then afterwards there was another interview hiring manager. After the interview process over zoom I was extended an offer pretty quickly. After the acceptance I ending up starting 2 weeks later
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Medical Laboratory Technologist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by talent acquisition consultant by email only. She asked several questions in the email but she never called me. After one week, I emailed her to follow up and she stated "I am waiting for the hiring team to let me know." Two days  later I received the auto-generated rejected email. I would have expected to recieve a screening call like other organizations instead of via email.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for a new position?

title: Staff Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Discussed job opportunity with manager of department then was set up for a virtual interview with the director of the program and supporting staff.  I interviewed for a specific clinic position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to make a difficulty decision and what was the outcome?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a normal interview process and it went smooth.  I have no concerns but I was a referral from my friend which made it easier. It was easy enough
Interview Questions: I choose not to type about this

title: Community Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process was easy and flexible. I   was able to speak on my skills and received feedback. I   was contacted after the interview within a few days. Overall great, organized process.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Multiple step interview process. First you speak with a recruiter and then with the manager. They ask multiple questions along the lines of "tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient".
Interview Questions: They ask multiple questions along the lines of "tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient".

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied and they emailed me that same day . It was sent as a zoom invitation I haven’t yet interviewed for the position but they require a phone or zoom meeting first
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work there

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Behavior skill interview; video conference interview and then phone screen interview with the hiring manager. Basic interview questions for general positions many many many many many many many many many many
Interview Questions: Tell me about your job history?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions:
Zoom meeting with Supervisor. Zoom meeting with supervisor, shift supervisor and team member.
Questions asked were about team work, what I bring to the table. etc.
Then I applied formally for the position. The details were reviewed and an offer was made in email. I am still considering the offer.

xxxxxxxxxxxxx
Interview Questions: What type of work environment do you work in best?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Put in application. Got an email for an interview. Spoke with nurse manager told about position. Then next interview I had to sit there an hour to see if I like the position. Afterwards was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Registered Nurse (CN1) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied for float pool, it said no experience required but you actually had to have experience. Wasnt eligible for the position. The recruiter called me and we had a conversation, but at the end told me that I did not have enough experience for that float pool. Wish they would have said they would have liked experience so I wouldn't have wasted my time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience?

title: Infection Preventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Fargo, ND) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very smooth. Prompt. The team is accommodating to the needs of the employee. They were very fun and provided an overall relaxing experience throughout the process. I did a 3 step interview. And all three of them were really good. They were very interactive.
Interview Questions: What motivates you to apply for this position at Duke?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: You apply online and will have a zoom interview on your phone or computer. First with manager, second with other staff assistants and last with providers. Very challenging interview process.
Interview Questions: Weakness and Strengths of your background

title: Patient Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was long. There was about an hour long phone call and afterwards the supervisor shared that she would let final candidates know who would be moving forward to the next interviews. I was selected and scheduled for three zoom interviews that began around 9 am with different individuals within the company. The last of the three was with the supervisor again who  conducted almost the same exact interview in the phone conversation. Afterwards I was provided two writing samples to be completed and told that I would be provided an update either way. These interviews were completed by 6 pm. A long day for someone who had a job and could luckily work from home.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of integrity?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions:
Step 1: Speak with Nurse Recruiter who will ask about your interest and schedule your interview with units that best fit
Step 2: Interview with the nurse manager or charge nurse  and other people about the job. There are interview questions-be prepared for scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: I do not remember a specific interview question

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick respose from the time I applied to the time I was called for an interview. I meet two levels of hiring managers. The questions were the typical interview questions in general and software development questions.
Interview Questions: The question was if I was EPIC certified.

title: CRC I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: they answered all of my questions in detail and responded to emails in a timely manner. I felt the questions they asked were fair and relative to the position I was seeking
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview is similar to a panel interview and the interviewers consist of the social work team you are hoping to join. Each social worker will ask a question and you respond to the group at large. Sometimes they have follow up questions based on your answers.
Interview Questions: They asked questions about your ability to work on a team and difficult customer service interactions you've had.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews with HR, then one with the team manager than another with a team member.  Then they asked for a mini test project to confirm my technical skills.    For a mid-level role the process was longer than expected and took over a month between all the calls and emails.
Interview Questions: Gave me a mini test project.  Create a script to deploy a static web-page on a computer with Linux, Mac, or Windows OS.

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Very extensive interview process. Asked in depth questions so do your research and review before hand. Knowledge of why you did the processes in previous jobs is important. Ask to see where exactly you will be working.
Interview Questions: I can’t remember an exact interview question?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (San Antonio, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy process, turnaround time to get an answer was long. Had to continuously call to check on status after my initial offer. Total time before start date was about 2-3 months. My recruiter was very helpful throughout the entire process.
Interview Questions: Simple questions, just like any other interview

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: In person interview at clinic with manager. Introduction and overview of job followed by a few behavioral based questions. It was about 35 minutes long and while the clinic was busy the interview was not rushed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to handle multiple tasks at one time. How did you handle it and what was the result?

title: Invasive Cardiovascular Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Columbus, GA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Horrible communication, kept the camera off the hole time. Director did not ask any questions. Staff was catty from day one. Very unprofessional more interested in being petty than the care of the actual patient.
Interview Questions: Can you scrub a case alone?

title: HIM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I don't agree with behavioral based questions as starting interview because you don't get the chance to showcase yourself. The interviewers were emotionless and seemed more interested in writing down my response than actually listening or understanding it. My frustration is the fact that I got a system generated denial, the same one they give you if you never interview, about 11 days after I interviewed. Impersonable and borderline insulting process.
Interview Questions: Q: Explain a time you had to work with difficult co-workers, how you went through the process, and what was the outcome.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter reached out to me first about the positions i would be interested in and then he set one up. I attended an open house virtual hiring event. It went well and was very organized, not stressful at all.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: One day of 30 minute interviews with other faculty members. This was conducted over Zoom due to COVID-19. There was a brief break in between interviews. An additional 1 hour long job talk was also required the morning of the interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen with HR before scheduling an interview. Set up an interview in person with HR, followed by shadowing a nurse on the unit and an interview with the Nurse Manager.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: online application - got a call to setup a phone interview for the screening process.  Then they set up a date to meet with the nurse manager for a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you encountered a problem, talk about a difficult situation, how do you handle stress, and multitasking, why you want to work here.

title: New Graduate Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: The initial call with HR was great. Very nice and helpful human resources staff. They next invite you to interview with the units you’ve applied to. They will set up days and times that work best for you to meet with the nursing managers on their unit. The process is overall very professional and welcoming!
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to deal with a difficult coworker, peer, or manager and how did you go about solving the issue?

title: Social Work Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very formal and quick paced, but felt comfortable.  I was surprised how well prepared I felt when answering the questions, there were no questions that really seemed odd or out of place, just general interview questions.
Interview Questions: They asked questions about my valuable experience that could apply to the job.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Met with the recruiter, scheduled a zoom interview with the nurse manager. Say on zoom call for an hour by myself. Nurse manager never showed up.  Rescheduled the interview, thought it went great, sounded promising. Never heard anything back. Scheduled another interview for another position and received an email literally 10 mins before saying it was canceled.
Interview Questions: What made you want to become a nurse?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Half hour phone call with hiring manager. 3 panel interviews in 1 day with at least 2 people per panel. process took about a month to get an offer. I felt like I was being put off
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to deal with a difficult customer

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview with manager and then the team you’d be working with. Not sure what to expect for the next steps. Everyone was really nice. They all took turns asking questions and some of the questions were definitely challenging.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in the past few years?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Two call interviews through the phone and Zoom, one with HR, one with a nurse manager, was notified a week later. They asked behavioral and technical questions. Was overall an easy and transparent experience.
Interview Questions: Why Duke?

title: ICU Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Tampa, FL) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interviewing process (especially during a Pandemic). I applied in the morning about two weeks ago and was contacted that same day for a phone interview with the recruiter. I spoke with the recruiter that next day and setup an interview a week later with the manager of ICU via zoom meeting. We spoke on zoom and phone for about an hour and a half and asked typical behavioral interview questions and some fun questions. I was also taken around the unit via zoom and shown the unit and spoke with two other nurses. I was then contacted three days later with a job offer!
Interview Questions:
Why Duke?
Have you ever dealt with a difficult colleague before?
Tell me something about yourself that I would not know from your resume?
What is something you don't like about your current job?
What do you look forward too when you come to work?

title: Mlt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward and relaxed.  Interviewed with the day and night supervisors.  They took turns back and forth asking lots of questions. A lot of the questions were related to the lab and how you handled situations.
Interview Questions: How well do you do under pressure

title: Performance Services - Management Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Unfortunately I had a very negative experience with the hiring process for Duke Performance Services that felt disorganized and unprofessional. Despite applying in November, I didn't receive initial feedback until three months later, and the entire process took a total of almost four months. About two months into waiting for any response, I was scheduled for my first interview (virtual), however while I was awaiting that scheduled interview, I received an automated email saying that I was no longer being considered for the role. After following up with Performance Services directly and informing them that the online portal indicated my removal from the candidate pool, they informed me that I WAS still being considered... This disorganization was both frustrating and unsettling, especially for an organization in charge of implementing "operational improvements" across Duke Health. I then had a virtual interview with a panel, followed by an on-site interview with three groups of two interviewers a few weeks later. All of the questions were behavioral and easy. During the on-site, the first two pairs of interviewers asked me the same questions, which was bizarre... After what I thought was a strong interview and very strong academic and professional background that directly satisfied the job posting's qualifications, I was informed about a week later that I had not been offered the job. What was most upsetting was the reason given in the email -- citing that they want candidates from Industrial and Systems Engineering Backgrounds. And this was after I was told repeatedly that no prior healthcare or systems knowledge was needed, and that they had a mentorship/education program to teach new hires anything they needed to succeed. Considering that during this entire time my resume very clearly spelled out my academic/professional history, this information about a poor fit should have been shared with me way way earlier, instead of stringing me along for four months. Overall, I feel it was a poor interview experience. My advice to Duke Performance Services: if you want cookie-cutter applicants from a particular major or academic institution, be open about this in your job listing, or at least during your first panel interview.
Interview Questions: What are you most proud of, and other broad easy behavioral questions

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Very simple conversation. Small ten minute conversation between hiring manager. I was asked 3 questions about my interest in the field. Great description of the unit and expectations. Was called later that week with an offer.
Interview Questions: What interest you in cardiac?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Very quick process, impressed with the promptness of moving along! I was able to shadow prior to my interview so this was helpful in getting to know the unit that I would be working on. The interview was very comfortable and easy going! Duke seems to have their stuff together compared to other hospitals I've applied for so the entire process in general really impressed me.
Interview Questions: What is a pet peeve of yours?

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a straight forward process. The interviewer was personable and friendly. Very down to earth. I felt comfortable the entire time. The questions are what you would generally expect out of most first interview process criteria. It was done over the phone.
Interview Questions: How did I handle a difficult situation.

title: CVOR Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Caucasian recruiter called a Black nurse mid 50s to interview with young Caucasian manager, phillipine male who called this a panel interview lasted 30minutes about how hard he works and takes a month vacation in his country
Interview Questions: How long you been a nurse in this position

title: Revenue Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview with multiple stakeholders based on experience. Phone interview first followed by in-person interview (day long) with various stakeholders/ customers. Offer extended within 2 weeks of on-site. No surprises, and no behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Strengths, Why would be good fit, What will I bring, How my experience tie to sought after role

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I went to the October New Graduate RN Career Fair and attending that event made the overall process much easier. I gave my resume to units that I was interested in working for and was able to set up an interview with my top 3 on the spot.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were mostly behavioral.

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a phone interview with an HR associate. They asked a few behavioral questions and then had me pick my top unit. I was given a date to come in for an interview and shadow during that phone call. The in person was very laid back and comfortable. The nurse manager and the staff on the unit were so welcoming. It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time that you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Application went through the Duke Job Board. HR called me about an interview with RN Management. The interview was seamless and no stress. I only interviewed with one manager and then walked to the unit and spent time with the other nurses.
Interview Questions: Very basic. The manager did not go through the typical behavior based questions. It was very informal.

title: Associate Director of Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Morrisville, NC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It took a few weeks, but I got a phone interview that lasted maybe 15 minutes. Than was selected for in person interviews with five different panels that took five hours to do. I met with two VPs that went very well. The others were unorganized and seemed to be slapped together at the last minute. In fact I was asked to go to the cafeteria to wait for my next interview. I sat there for an hour and fifteen minutes. They forgot about me. It was extremely unorganized and not at all planned out.
Interview Questions: They asked basic questions. They didn’t take any notes or had anything to go off of. I asked more questions about the position than they did.

title: Pool Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone and then in person. Interviewer was very easy to talk too. Very relaxed and open. Discussed more about the work environment and procedures. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience in health care customer service

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied on a Friday, received a call for a phone interview the following Monday, received an email for an in person interview the following day! In the morning I met with HR to talk about benefits and compensation. Then met with staff members and the manager of the unit I applied to.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths / weaknesses? What characteristics do you wish to bring to Duke? How do you handle stress and working with difficult coworkers?

title: Lactation Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed only by one nursing manager and surprised a  Lactation Consultant was not involved in the interview.  The nurse manager was friendly and knowledgeable about mother baby nursing care and management but not about Lactation issues.  She seemed most concerned about scheduling and how many patients I could see in a day.
Interview Questions: mostly about why I wanted the job and my availability

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and it took 8 weeks to hear back from the recruiter. They ask for references before the interview. I completed those and the interview was set for when I was available. I met with the unit manager and then shadowed a nurse on the unit. Everyone was nice and the interview went well. They chose another candidate, but I'd definitely apply again.
Interview Questions: The questions were behavioral questions and then she asked if I had any questions.

title: Clinical Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Long process, by the time they called me for an interview the position I initially applied for was already filled. I was offered the same job but different hours. Overall it was an average interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called for a phone interview a few days later. Went in for an in person interview that next week and a couple of weeks later went in for a second in person interview. Was between me and another candidate and I didn’t get offered that position but a lower one instead sadly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience as a clinical research coordinator

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough interview process. Met with numerous people. Quality institution. Be prepared and do prep beforehand.  Hiring time period is extended. Don’t expect to start right away. Overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Given clinical scenarios and how I would react.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Extremely friendly hiring manager. Very welcoming environment. I was given a tour around the unit and I was given 1 hours to shadow an experienced nurse at the 4300 unit. I would love to work in this unit in the future is adult medicine is your passion
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: I filled out a application online. Got an email 2 days later about doing a phone interview. I did a phone interview with the hiring manager. Immediately after got setup with another interview with hiring manager and HR manager. Immediately after that got set up with a webex interview with 2 physicians and the team lead.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength and biggest weakness?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: You speak with the nurse recruitment office and a specific recruiter who is assigned to the units you are interested in. You interview with them briefly, they go over benefits, etc then you interview with the nurse managers in each dept.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple. I worked with a good team. I had a director and manager and they were great to work with. Overall, I had a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Lab Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Behavioral based interview. Fairly easy.  Know the role you are applying for and be confident when you answer the questions.
Your strength and weakness 
Willing to work extra hours
Tell me about your self
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with a difficult situation.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with current employee about my expectations and role in the workplace. Relatively informal as I had corresponded with the interviewer via email prior to the meeting.  Questions weren't too difficult to handle and I believe the interview was simply supplementary to the actual acceptation process.
Interview Questions: Do you have past experience in microbiology research?

title: Appoinment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Duke interview process take entirely too long. I applied who knows when, I was contacted to do a 3 question interview through email in July. Later had a phone interview a month later and finally had a panel interview (5 people were present). I was hired and started on October 5th.
Interview Questions: Have you had any bad interactions with another employee and how did you handle it.

title: PSA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews during about a 2 month period. I interviewed after submitting an online application, and was called about 2 weeks later for a job fair as a PSA/FCC. I was called in for a phone interview, then went to the job fair, after the job fair interview I was called to meet two supervisors.
Interview Questions: What is your level of experience with providers?

title: Patient Experience Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Multi-stage interview with the team and principal investigator.  Discuss experiences listed in CV and how I worked under pressure. The first interview was with the physician assistant, the second interview was with the research coordinator and the last interview was with the principal investigator.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this particular lab? What are your clinical experiences?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied at the end of October and received an email early December to set up an intro phone call. My intro phone call was with a recruiter who told me about the position and asked me a few behavioral questions, as well as questions about my resume/cover letter/experience. The phone call lasted 30 minutes and she said I would be hearing back soon if Duke wanted to move forward with an interview. A few days later I got an email saying the nurse manager wanted to do an interview. My interview lasted 30 minutes and was similar to my first phone call, with some different behavioral questions and why I wanted this position. The manager told me I would hear back within a few days and I received an offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your organizational skills, like how you would handle a group project

title: CNA I On Labor & Delivery Floor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: For the interview I was required to go the Nursing Recruitment office first. A recruiter met with me, took my HIPPA form, and then walked me up to the floor I was interviewing on. There I met with the nurse manager on that floor and she interviewed me for about 20-30 minutes. After the interview I shadowed another CNA on the floor for an hour.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in woman's health?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with a hiring manager and a current CNA. They both took turns asking questions about my current job and they gave me different scenarios and asked how I would respond to each.  I was able to ask the cna what was a typical day like for her. Overall, it was pretty good interview. They wanted to know more about how I would be as an employee rather than who I am as a person
Interview Questions: When was the last time you were lied to on the job?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied to an ad for multiple positions with the PDCs, heard back that I was invited to an interview with a recruiter. Interview went well, found out within a day that i had moved on to the next round. Heard from an office that I was invited to interview with them. Interviewed the following week, thought it went very well but was not offered a position, wish they would have emailed at least that they are not considering me for the position instead I had to find out through my job submission status.
Interview Questions: Basic personality questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I was applying for a position in the OR. I was invited to their NTTOR (New to the OR) Open House on a Thursday. The open house was 8am-3pm. They gave us an overview of the program, then split us up into 2 groups. About 25 went to shadow some surges, and the other 25 stayed and interviewed with the department of choice. Interviews were one-on-one and lasted about 15-20 minutes each.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to be an OR nurse?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied and interviewed for a position with Duke Network Services. Talked and met with Human Resources representatives and hiring manager several times, then they abruptly cut off contact and, despite my directly asking if I was still under consideration for the role, they declined to answer. I felt like I had been led on and my time had been wasted.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Super short.  Basically, can you start tomorrow?  Do you like this so far?  When can you start?  Let me show you around.  Do you still like it?  Do you still want to work here?
Interview Questions: Can you start tomorrow?

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 2 different nurses. The first asked me 2 behavorial type interview questions and the second one, describe the job function. Overall I felt very at ease and was pleased with how the interview went.,
Interview Questions: How well do you deal with conflict

title: Medical Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal transfer and was referred by a coworker. The interview was great. I was taken on a tour of the department and got the job. The hiring manager was wonderful
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Meet with local and senior leadership of the organization at the local clinic and then at corporate offices and meat senior leadership and others in the organization.  travelled around with a recruiter and was introduced to various team members in the clinic and within the organization
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing our organization?  What do you do well?   What are your strengths?  How do you deal with stress?   How do you handle situations?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was one round of interviews where I was interviewed by a panel of three people, including the hiring manager. It was fairly informal. I heard back less than a week later with an offer.
Interview Questions: The questions were fairly generic, like tell me about yourself, etc.

title: Lab Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via an industry job board and was called for an interview a week later. It's been two months since and still have't received an offer or not.
Interview Questions: How you ever had a disagreement with a coworker?

title: Ped Bone Marrow Transplant Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very professional but laid back and felt relaxed. I started my interview with a 2 hour on unit shadow experience with a current employee. This gave me a feel for the flow, work culture, and type of unit I was applying for. I then proceeded to the managers office, where we talked for about an hour. I had an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: How do you handle death and dying?

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Basic recruiter phone interview followed by a management interview. You can tour the unit and ask questions. Make sure to ask the nurses about the unit. There are many peopoe
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient?

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very condescending managers. Talked down to me as if I didn't know how to do the job. One manager was an assistant when I was a Senior lead a few years ago, acted like she knew more. I belive it to be personal because I left on maternity leave and didn't return.
Interview Questions: How to do everything little thing.  Asked if I wo uld  travel 100%.

title: Customer Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions:
I was informed of the opening by a friend and put in touch with the departmental director who is an acquaintance of that friend.
I submitted an application online.
I was interviewed by the department manager and a departmental supervisor.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your ability to deal with difficult people?

title: Ultrasoun Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: easy, not hard, basic interview stuff nothing got be worried about. interview, drug test, back ground check, no reference check. first a phone interview, then a face to face aong with other employees of the department
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Clinical Nurse Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview took place in four phases, each lasting approximately one hour. For the first round, I interviewed with the current managers of the department for which I was applying. The second round consisted of 4 other employees with the same job title and description as me. Of course, this was the more relaxed yet most important phase, as they are experts in their fields and would be able to provide very valuable feedback at the completion of the interview process. The third phase included the two directors that I would be working alongside. Lastly, I met with the ACNO.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for employment here, rather than staying where you are?

title: New Grad Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, set up an interview with a nurse manager and showed up to find it was with two nurse managers and one walked out to take a phone call halfway through.
Interview Questions:
Q: tell me about yourself
Q: tell us of a team you were on and the good and bad parts of the team
Q: give us a time someone lied to you and how you handled it
-other normal behavioral questions

title: Nurse Manager of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed by phone initially. I came to Durham and meet with the VP of Nursing , Director, Nurses Managers, and staff. I was then called back to interview with other upper management and physicians.  This went over a 3 to 4 weeks of time. It was long and drawn out. It would have been nice to complete in 1 week.
Interview Questions: Why did I want the position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Check in with nurse recruiter.  Hour interview with floor nurse manager, a charge nurse, and a preceptor. Regular back and forth discussion of unit and expectations; behavioral questions as forewarned. About another hour shadowing another nurse to get a feel for the floor. Got a tour of the unit and visited with some patients. Assisted lifting and moving but not patient assessment/care.
Interview Questions: What qualities, both positive and negative, do you see in your current coworkers? e.g. What do you want to emulate or avoid.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The overall hiring process was somewhat informal. It began with a tour of the facility and brief introductions. The questions asked were pretty typical. The facility/management was concerned about the character of the applicant.
Interview Questions: Basic questions: What is your 3, 5, 10 year plan? How do you treat patients with chronic pain? Behavioral interview type questions.

title: Data Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a different position and my resume was forwarded to hiring manager for a data tech position and I was contacted. I interviewed at the Duke Cancer center and it took about 2 weeks after the interview to find out about the job.
Interview Questions: The questions were all pretty typical. Asking about past experiences and background experiences that related to the roles of the position. Where you see yourself in 5 years and goals was asked.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview only lasted about 20 minutes - very short.  We talked about leadership, teamwork, and future goals.  It was somewhat casual with some typical interview topics sprinkled in.  There were several opportunities to pose questions about the unit, and she was happy to speak about both positive and negatives of the unit.
Interview Questions: What is one of your pet peeves?

title: Health Center Administrator/Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Knightdale, NC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There is a first for everything and this was a first for me.  1 phone interview and then 5 interviews with a total of 18 people for a HCA/Practice Manager position.  You would think I was interviewing for a CEO, CFO, COO, VP position, not a lonely HCA/Practice Manager position.  These people do overkill to the max.  These people over think everything. I didn't get the position which was a surprise to me because I had more experience and education then 90 percent of the people that interviewed me including the person who would have supervised me.  I didn't pay attention to the red flags when I applied for the position so I blame my self for the money and time I lost during the process.  The job had been open for almost 6 months and that is a red flag that these people have a hard time making small decisions when it comes to hiring.  My experience tell me they micro manage the hell out of you as a employee.  Do your research before using up time and money on Duke Health.  They had me drive to 3 sites in one day which was over 80 miles of driving for a interview.  Durham, Knightdale, Raleigh locations and they knew I had to drive in from out of town just for the interview.
Interview Questions: How well you get alone with others.  Huh, I was a social worker for 7 years, a Practice Manager for 15 years and have been in departments when I had to supervise up to 30 people. Really that's the type of questions you ask me.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Questions revolved around the job and not around me. Very few personal questions. Whenever i talked about my qualifications they didnt respond. Mostly they just wanted me to ask about the functions of the position i was applying for. It was friendly overall.
Interview Questions: Do you have any more questions?

title: Molecular Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions:
It was 14 years ago. Interviewed with 5 of the technical specialists, lab mgr and Director.
Multiple questions by all and repeated by the different groups
lab tour. The decision was relatively quick - 2 days later. I started after my contract was up in another lab.
Interview Questions: How would I transition from a clinical lab tech to a molecular tech

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy and the interviewers were laid back.  Met with three different groups of staff of all levels.  There was a second interview with a director.  There were not any situational questions.   They did want to know why I was interested in the position and what drew me to Duke.
Interview Questions: Past experience and details regarding job duties.

title: Management Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online video conference (1 hour) in which they asked basic behavioral questions. There was one graph to analyze and give feedback on. Then an on-site interview and facility tour a few weeks later. Full day very nicely done. Really a great chance to see what the office environment was like.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, some technical knowledge

title: Health Center Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Typical questions for a practice management:  I had the opportunity to meet with the physicians, clinical nurse managers, service access managers.  Really great staff and opportunity for advancement.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for the next 1-3 months?

title: Physician Revenue Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Duke Health in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: If your application had been selected for an interview, a member of the department’s hiring team contacted you to set up a time.The initial in-person interview was with the Senior Manager responsible for the specific area for the open positions. At the interview the job responsibilities were clearly outlined by the interviewee. If after the initial interview the Senior Manager determined you would be a viable candidate, they would forward your resume and their recommendation on to the department. The department would contact you for an interview.
Interview Questions: What would be your biggest challenge if you were selected for this position?

title: Program Coordinator PRMO Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just another company looking to hire the cheapest person possible. On job description didn’t mention I would be supervising 10 people so I gave a fair salary based off of job application. During job interview found out I would be supervising 10 people so asked for higher salary. Acted liked they couldn’t do that and received rejection email week later. Tried to bait and switch with job title.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work here?

title: Clinical Trial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: I found this job advertisement by a recruiting agency that I was using during my job search. The recruiting process took about 2 months, and it included a phone interview and on-site interviews.
Interview Questions: What is your experience as an assistant with clinical trials?

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview with basic questions. Came into the l office that I would work in and interviewed with my boss. Great explanation given on what I would do and what that office does. Talked about me.
Interview Questions: How can I contribute to the position?

title: Service Access Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Duke Health in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a several month long try out session pitting me against several other candidates that culminated in a panel interview with future subordinates followed by an "interview" with the manager.  The position had been promised to another individual for the length of the process and I felt as though I was wasting my time.  The panel interview was helpful and that, on top of my success during my weeks of try out compared to the other candidates, made the subordinates recommend me as a future supervisor.  The interview with the management wasn't an interview at all, but the manager talking the entire time.
Interview Questions: How would it affect my performance in my current role if I were not chosen for the position?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
give a talk to the lab, meet with everybody, ask about: 
•	"how do you deal with a difficult stakeholder?" and "how do you influence them to adopt change?"  
•	preferred working environment, management structure and style, how I fit into a group
•	tell me about a time when you had to deliver bad news," 
•	 "tell me about a time when you had to work with someone you didn't like,"
Interview Questions: mainly previous expeirence, good questions on scientific project, what is interested project

title: Patient Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by Team lead and a supervisor.  Position was explained and then questions were asked.  The ladies were very pleasant and made me feel comfortable..I was asked if I had any questions. Some behavioral questions asked as well as skills questions.. The supervisor was big on teamwork..Good customer service is a must..
Interview Questions: What is my definition of teamwork?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took over 2 months. It was difficult to get feedback in a timely manner and there were multiple steps that could have been condensed into one or two if people had gotten their schedules coordinated better.  As a result, I took a job where my current employer conducted their interviews within 1 week and made an offer.
Interview Questions: Multiple questions about networking protocols and white boarding my understanding of networks.

title: Clinical Nurse I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for new graduate nurse position. Got an offer for interview via email. Interview was consisted for meeting with nurse recruiter and unit manager and shadow with staff nurse for 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Who is your role model?

title: Customer Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Waited 45 min to be brought back to start the interview. Interviewed by two managers. They asked questions from a questionaire..about 25 questions about skills and situations. I was then taken to the dept manager who asked a few questions and gave me her card. She was very polite as other two managers were and welcoming.
Was called four days later with an EXCELLENT job offer and i will start in two weeks.
Interview Questions:
Tell about a time where you had to deal with a customer who was upset?

How do do you feel about a job sitting behind a desk all day on the phone?

title: Patient Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, one face to face interview with practice manager. Basic questions about skill set, experience and team work. No question was really unexpected or out of the box.
Interview Questions: Question was asked about how I would handle a difficult co worker. Who knew this was an indication of things to come with that office. This office was dominated by employees whom have worked at this particular office for years and were very set in their ways and bad habits.

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Completed on line job application, was called, set up interview, met with three individuals.  One was the hiring manager, but then I interviewed with the physicians I actually would be working for.  I was offered position via a email and phone call within two weeks.  Then negotiated salary.  Were interested to see if I had degrees or certifications.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult people who you work with

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview then hired. Questions asked about experience at other employment position, days to work, skills, problem solving.  Did a short tour of the department and various areas will be working in and responsibility expected.
Interview Questions: What hours can I work?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then in-person interview with several people. Process was pretty quick. Was contacted about a week after I applied online and contacted a few days after the phone interview for the next interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Grants and Contracts Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview took an hour and a half.  Interviewed with 3 different people because they had two different positions available.  It has been several years since I have had to interview for a job, so I probably was not prepared for what I was about to walk into.  Most of the interview questions were behavioral based questions.
Interview Questions: I should've been a little better prepared for this interview.  Oh well, maybe next time.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted within a week by the project managers who then conducted a phone interview and a subsequent in-person interview a week after.
Interview Questions: What is your work philosophy? or Where do think statistical methods in this field are going in the future?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: First, phone interview. Typical and very low key. In person interview was slightly more aggressive with questions and discussed skills. Third interview wasn't an interview... more like meeting the big wigs in the office.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very disjointed.  There was a panel over 3+ hours with three people.  The process was lacking any real informative information and didn't lend much to what overall happened.
Interview Questions: How does a network route? What are the 7 network layers?  What is DHCP?

title: Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process up to now has been excellent. There was an open house for the facility in my town. The nurse managers were available to answer questions to candidates and interview on the spot. That was very successful. I was called back for a second interview and to shadow an employee for 2-3 hours, to make sure that this was what I really wanted, then I was interviewed again. I still haven't been hired, but I no that the job is mine.
Interview Questions: Present a case in which you had to go over and beyond the call of duty in order to provide care to your patient.

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a brief process. Sat down w/ nurse manager who asked limited questions about my past employment history, and a few clinic questions. She then showed me around the office, introduced me to the providers and employees and sent me on my way
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC)
Interview Descriptions: You  first have to apply through ERAS - submit all of your information on that and then select which programs you want to send your information to.  Then they may or may not invite you for an interview.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot about research

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied while a student at Duke. They informed us when the job posting would be released. It was closed rather quickly. This was one of the years when it was hard for new grad RNs to find work. I interviewed first with the manager, then had a peer interview. I think it took almost a month.
Interview Questions: I wasn't surprised by questions. Maybe just about my skills, as I didn't know what they were looking for specifically.

title: Medical Coder II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was ok, long for a day and met with several staff members, and was given a lunch break. Very unorganized when I arrived and had to wait for a team member to come and bring me upstairs. The staff was very nosey and loud.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire, what do you have that other candidates do not have.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: At that time you filled out an application and then if they were interested they called you for a one on one interview if they liked you they let you know at that time
Interview Questions: why do you want to work at Duke

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
some pre-interview phone questions:

- why do you want to work at duke
- describe a difficulty and how you overcame it
- describe a situation where multitasking was necessary and how did you complete your work
- what do you like about your current job
- what do you not like about your current job
- how would you rate yourself between 1 - 10 on the follow qualifications: interpersonal skills, technical ability, creativity, ability to learn, etc (whatever qualification you rated yourself lowest on, then they ask what have you done recently to improve yourself in that area)

actual interview was 1 hour in-person with hiring manager and clinical lead followed by 2 hour shadow of team members.
Interview Questions: what would your last supervisor say about you.  who are some of the difficult doctors you have worked with and how did you handle them.

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel of management team, asked questions then if they liked you are moved to the next step that day. After that it takes them at least 2 months to get back to you. Lack of communication
Interview Questions: do you have call center exp. medical back ground.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Contacted for F2F interview and shadow a month later. Interview is with 3 nurse managers. Shadow an RN for 1 hour on the unit you prefer afterwards. Job offer 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you have that make you stand out, compared to other applicants.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty general process. I saw the job posting online and applied. About a week and a half after I submitted my application, I got an email from my PI requesting a phone interview. The interview was fairly standard (previous research experience, availability during the week, how many hours per week I'd be willing to commit to the research). I received my offer about a week after my interview.
Interview Questions: Please describe your previous research experience.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I replied to an email job announcement.  Then I did a brief phone interview and was invited in for an in person interview.  The interview was laid back and a smooth process.
Interview Questions: Theoretical Orientation

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively extensive and positive.  The interview allowed me the opportunity to meet with the entire team as well as senior administrators and gave me a full picture of the place that I sought to work.  The interview gave me a great picture of what employment would look like.
Interview Questions: My strengths.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was surprised by the number of people at the interview.  I wasn't able to really figure out why I wasn't selected.  They were friendly though.  It got a little awkward towards the end.
Interview Questions: are you okay handling blood

title: Revenue Integrity Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by a recruiter about the position, and hired to be a consultant. After being there for two months I was offered a full-time position. I received a call from the HR representative regarding the position. Intitially, I was surprised because the salary I was told the position offered was much lower than what the HR representative told me they were willing to offer me.
Interview Questions: After hearing about the salary it took me a moment to think about what I wanted to do. Having made the move from home I was somewhat disappointed with Duke and my recruiter and ready to go back home. However, after taking some time to think and to renegotiate we found a middle ground and I accepted the offer to come on board. The most unexpected question was why would someone with my qualifications take this position at Duke?

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Similar to other interviews. Very standardized as per Acgme rules. Very nice faculty and staff interviewers gave a very honest and positive outlook on the facility. Tours were very extensive and residents who were currently in the program were very helpful and forthcoming with information about the process and the facility.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Laboratory Research Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview then an in person interview.  In person interview lasted about an hour.  It took about a month from the end of the phone interview to set up the in person interview.  Once the in person interview occurred I was called and offered the job the next day to which I accepted.
Interview Questions: What strengths do I have that make me the best candidate for the position?

title: Clinical Trials Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with immediate supervisor. Basic questions about computer competency, scientific literacy and competency, and expected duties. Short tour of facility and description of duties expected. Pay rate explained. Benefits explained. Very straightforward.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with computers? Specifically MS Excel and Access.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions: Why should we hire you? Where do you see yourself in 5 years? You actually need to sell yourself. In case if you don't have experience tell that you are eager to learn new skills and you are very good team player etc.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview is pretty easy. Then got reject letter stating over qualified
Interview Questions: why you want to work for Duke

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: I went to the hospital in person to speak with a recruiter but a receptinist at HR stated that I had to submit my resume on line first.  Since I was employee in the past, it would be a rehire, and I already knew people in management. There was no openingpositions available on line for medical surgical RN at the time of my interview. I went to see the manager for surgical floor but she was not in her office. I run into a clinical specialist, and he set an interview date with a medical floor manager for me. Three days later, I went in, had an interview with a medical floor manager (clinical specialist present in the room) and was offered an job. For the technicality, I still had to apply my resume on line. One of the nurses was retiring in a month, and I became her replacement.
Interview Questions: The manager at the time asked me, knowing that I used to work for Duke Raleigh, what I would change about the work place.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: At Duke University Health System every division, department, group, etc.  has its own interview process. I had interviews that consistent of a 30-min conversation with just a hiring manager and some that included a phone interview and then lasted half a day being interviewed by multiple people. Needless to say that some groups/ departments are more professional than others.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to talk to surgeons?

title: Team Lead, Patient Accounts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Duke Health in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Received an email for the opportunity to interview.  I had a group interview, where supervisors along with seasoned employees interviewed me to see how I would fit in.  Questions ranged from my work experience to if playing music bothered me.  I knew immediately that I was hired, but also received an offer letter in the mail as well as through email.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years...

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Duke Health in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Online application. Face to Face. Follow up
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Duke

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was smooth, coordinated and effecient.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: MANAGER, CLINICAL SERVICES Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, I received a call several weeks later to conduct a telephone interview. Next I traveled to NC to interview over two days with all stake holders. I received an offer two weeks later, and started withing one month.
Interview Questions: Certain clinical details specific to the organizations methods not employed at other facilities.

title: Team Lead, Patient Accounts Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Couple interviews
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Data Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Short interview process I work as an intern and they offered me a job really there wasnt an interview. It was just here is what we will offer you and benefits you will get. So I took the job it was pretty simple, wish I had interview now so i could
Interview Questions: What is your worst behavoir.

title: Lab Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very casual. Because the position was a part-time position for a graduate student, the atmosphere was very informal. The interviewer (my boss) asked questions about items listed on my resume. Naturally she gave me examples of tasks that I would have to complete for the jaob and wanted to know if I had done them before. The office staff was very pleasant.
Interview Questions: will this job affect your studies?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: You meet team members one by one
Interview Questions: If you could be any animal what would it be and why?

title: Data Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: consisted of one on one interview, painless procedure, managers tend to be laid back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Duke Health (Durham, NC) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: Me and several other people were called in as a group to discuss the benefits, rules, and regulations, for working at duke.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you
